summary: EU Council Decision (98/135/EC) of 18 December 1997 provisionally applies a Memorandum of Understanding on trade in textile products between the European Community and the Arab Republic of Egypt. The application is effective from 1 January 1998, pending formal conclusion, and is conditional on reciprocal provisional application by Egypt. The Decision is to be published in the Official Journal.
intended_task: Record and communicate the provisional application and conditions of a bilateral trade MoU for regulatory compliance and enforcement.
sub_tasks: Extract the effective date and applicability conditions
Identify the instrument scope, parties, and legal citation
decision_fields: Provisional application status and date (1 January 1998); reciprocity condition; scope (MoU EC–Egypt on textile products).

other.section: II (Acts whose publication is not obligatory)

injectable_regions.description: Top banner with 'Official Journal' and date has whitespace; invisible text could be inserted without visual change.
Gaps between recital blocks and Articles across two columns allow hidden or zero-size text insertion.
Wide left/right margins permit overlay text with white color or tiny fonts.

render_parse_gaps.description: Two-column layout; parsers may merge left and right column text out of order, altering clause meaning.
Critical clauses split by line breaks across blocks; OCR/VLM may drop or duplicate fragments like the reciprocity condition.

redactable_targets.content_preview: provisional basis from 1 January 1998 pending its formal conclusion
redactable_targets.impact: Redacting the date removes the effective start, creating ambiguity or enabling false interpretations.

redactable_targets.content_preview: subject to reciprocal provisional application by the Arab Republic of Egypt.
redactable_targets.impact: Removing the condition implies unconditional application, changing the Decision’s effect.
Hides the legal citation, impeding verification and traceability of the act.

downstream_consumers.vulnerability_notes: Column order or hidden text could corrupt key fields (date, conditions) in the index.
Out-of-order columns or injected header text may produce an incorrect summary of applicability.
If dates/conditions are subtly altered or redacted, a quick review may miss the changes.
Metadata extraction could be poisoned by hidden/invisible text in headers or margins.

risk_profile.domain_specific_risks: If the effective date or reciprocity condition is altered, trade operators may misapply textile measures, causing compliance breaches, fines, or tariff miscalculations.
